p: Fagonia L., is a genus of wild, flowering plants of the family, Zygophyllaceae, having about 45 species all over the world. The distribution of the genus includes parts of Africa, the Mediterranean Basin, Asia and parts of the America. In Pakistan, 10 species are reported earlier. Seven species are found during the present study in southern zones of Balochistan Province. Fagonia species were collected to determine the presence of phytochemical compounds. Earlier reported phytochemicals were alkaloids, coumarins, flavonols, saponins, triterpenoid saponins, tannins, cardiac glycosides, and rosmarinic acid [ 22, 23].
